message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.SE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as it deals with developing an algorithm for Monte Carlo tree search (MCTS) in games and Markov decision processes. It also involves metareasoning, which is a common topic in AI research. 

The paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as MCTS is a type of reinforcement learning, and the paper proposes new policies for multi-armed bandits that outperform existing ones. 

Game Theory (cs.GT) is another likely sub-category as MCTS is commonly used in game theory research. 

Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) is a possible sub-category as the paper involves developing new sampling policies for MCTS. 

Finally, Software Engineering (cs.SE) is a possible sub-category as the paper proposes a new algorithm for MCTS that outperforms existing ones, which could be of interest to software developers working on game AI.
